name: Egg Salad Sandwich

ingredients.ingredient: finely chopped chives or green onions

instructions: Place the eggs in a pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, then turn off the heat, cover, and let sit for 10 minutes.
Transfer eggs to an ice water bath until cool, then peel and chop.
In a bowl, combine the chopped eggs with mayonnaise, mustard, celery, chives, salt, and pepper. Mix gently until well combined.
Toast the bread if desired. Optionally spread with butter or lay down lettuce.
Divide the egg salad between two slices of bread and top with the remaining slices.
Cut in half and serve immediately, or wrap and refrigerate for later.

storage_tips.room_temp: Best eaten fresh. Keep at room temperature for no more than 2 hours.
storage_tips.refrigeration: Store leftover egg salad in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Assemble sandwiches just before eating for best texture.
